title: Open-ended Questions
description: These phrases help you think of your own questions to ask, so you can make your conversations longer.

conversations.usage: Ask about the time something happened (or will happen).
conversation: How's your day going?
Great! I got a new job!
Congratulations! When do you start?
My first day is next Monday.
That's awesome! Are you excited?
conversations.title: When...?

conversations.usage: Ask about the location of something.
conversation: Do you have any plans for the rest of the weekend?
I'm going to walk my friend's cute new puppy!
Aww! Where are you going to walk?
Probably just around the neighborhood.
Cool! What kind of dog is it?
conversations.title: Where...?

conversation: How is your week going?
Good! I am going to see some friends tonight.
That's awesome! What are you going to do together?
We are going to have dinner at a restaurant.
Cool! What restaurant are you going to?
conversations.title: What...?

conversation: How was your weekend?
It was good, we went to the library.
Nice! Who did you go with?
I went with my kids and my husband.
Cool! Do your kids like the library?
conversations.title: Who...?

conversation: What do you think about this weather?
It's terrible. I really don't like when it rains!
I'm sorry to hear that. Why don't you like the rain?
Because I get wet on my way to work.
Aww...do you walk to work?
conversations.title: Why...?

conversation: Are you excited for the weekend?
Yes, we are going to Los Angeles!
Awesome! How are you getting there?
We are driving. I hope the traffic is not bad.
I hope so too! What time are you leaving?
conversations.title: How...?

conversation: How was your weekend?
Great! My brother's birthday was on Saturday.
That's awesome! Did you give him a present?
Yes, I gave him a book. He loves to read.
Cool! What book did you give him?
conversations.title: Did you...?

conversations.usage: Ask about a length of time.
conversation: How was your weekend?
It was good! We went to the beach to have a picnic.
Oh, interesting! How long were you at the beach?
Just for a few hours. We came home for dinner.
Cool! How was the weather?
conversations.title: How long...?

conversations.usage: Ask what made something good or bad.
conversation: How was your day today?
Gooooooood.
That's awesome! What was good about it?
I played soccer during recess.
That's great! Who did you play with?
conversations.title: What was ___ about it?
